result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Jay Escamilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: COURT WILL ALLOW PROBATION TO BE TERMINATED AFTER 9 MONTHS IF THE DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES ALL CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

- AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
- Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.
- Participate in cognitive therapy.
- Perform 15 hours of community service.
- Participate in parenting classes.
- Maintain full time work/school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Jay Escamilla

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION ON MAY 22, 2015.  CASE RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 9, 2015 AT 8:30 AM.  PLEASE NOTIFY YOUR CLIENT OF THE CHANGE.  IF THIS DATE IS INCONVENIENT, PLEASE CONTACT THE CLERK AT 414-278-4775 TO RESCHEDULE.

Defendant Brandon Jay Escamilla in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia 
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brandon Jay Escamilla in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  
Defendant Brandon Jay Escamilla in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
